clinicalDescription: Overview: Inflammation of the thyroid, Divided into painful and painless forms Presentation: Range of symptoms: from no symptoms to neck swelling to globus (sensation of something stuck in throat) to pain on the thyroid gland and pain swallowing. Assessment: Physical exam, medication review, labs including TSH, anti thyroid antibodies, thyroid ultrasound Plan: Treat underlying cause of thyroid inflammation (medications, surgery) Prognosis: Typically excellent prognosis.
